alert.note: Alert for Daniels; Dawson; Garfield; McCone; Petroleum; Phillips; Prairie; Richland; Roosevelt; Sheridan; Valley; Wibaux (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 06 at 6:16PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOODING POSSIBLE FROM MELTING SNOWPACK NEXT WEEK... Much warmer temperatures are expected this weekend and early next week. This will result in melting at least some of the snow that remains on the ground across the region. By Monday, highs are expected to range from the 50s across northern Phillips and northern Valley Counties to the 70s along and south of the Missouri River. Lows Sunday Night and Monday Night are expected to be above freezing in all areas which will accelerate the melting of snow. Runoff from melting snow will bring rising water and a chance of flooding to the Milk and Poplar Rivers, Beaver, Frenchman, Big Muddy and Red Water Creeks and any small streams across the area. Also, ice jams are possible on the Missouri River east of Wolf Point and the Yellowstone River across Dawson and Richland Counties this weekend and next week as ice breaks up on those rivers. Ice jams can produce rapid rises in river levels and lead to flooding with little or no warning. Now is the time to get ahead of the melt. If you have equipment and/or livestock in a low lying area, now is the time to move them to higher ground.
